intro: Sida violifolia, commonly known as violetleaf sida, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its small, violet-colored flowers and hairy stems. It typically grows in moist, sunny habitats such as grasslands and wetlands. Sida violifolia is often found in regions with warm climates and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
